intro: Senecio teneriffae, commonly known as the Teneriffe groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a low-growing shrub characterized by its gray-green, woolly leaves and yellow daisy-like flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the arid climate of its native habitat. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads. Senecio teneriffae is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
